original: PALANDER, Tord Folkeson, Professor, Göteborg, f Sthlm 6/10 02 av civ.ing F P o Elin Sandberg, gm Margareta Abrahmsén. Studex öReal 20, KTH (kemi) 26, fil kand 29, fil lie StHS (nat.ek) 31, fil dr 35. Doc nat.ek StHS 35—37 o 38—41, v Upps univ 37—38, bitr lär o examin nat.ek v filos fak Upps, spec.lär KTH, lär KSS 38—41, prof nat.ek m statistik Gbgs Hdlshögsk sed. 41. Led 42 års järnv.-kostn.utredn, led 43 års järnvägskté (»Smal-spårsbaneutreeln»), div off ek utredn.uppdr, vetensk rådgiv SJ :s kostnadsråd. Vetensk rådg Sv Gallupinst op.undersökn. Stud.res Frankr 26, 28, Tyskl 30—31, Norge, Engl, USA 35—37. Av trycket: »Beiträge zur Standortstheorie» (35), »Nat.ek f råg o uppg» (40), »Kostn.be-räkii o taxepolit v SJ» (tills m E Lindahl 41), upps i ek facktidskr.
translated: PALANDER, Tord Folkeson, Professor, Gothenburg, born in Stockholm on October 6, 1902, son of civil engineer F P and Elin Sandberg, married to Margareta Abrahmsén. Studied Real science in 1920, Chemistry at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1926, Bachelor of Arts in 1929, Master of Arts (Natural Economy) at StHS (Stockholm School of Economics) in 1931, PhD in 1935. Assistant Professor of Natural Economy at StHS from 1935 to 1937 and 1938 to 1941, visiting Uppsala University from 1937 to 1938, Assistant Lecturer and Examiner of Natural Economy at the Faculty of Philosophy in Uppsala, Special Lecturer at KTH, and Lecturer at KSS (Gothenburg School of Economics) from 1938 to 1941, Professor of Natural Economy with Statistics at Gothenburg School of Economics since 1941. Member of the 1942 Railway Cost Investigation, member of the 1943 Railway Committee ("Narrow-gauge Rail Exploration"), various public economic investigations, scientific advisor to SJ's (Swedish Railways) Cost Council, scientific advisor to the Swedish Gallup Institute's opinion surveys. Study trips to France in 1926 and 1928, Germany in 1930 to 1931, Norway, England, and the USA from 1935 to 1937. Published works: "Contributions to Location Theory" (1935), "Economic Questions and Tasks" (1940), "Cost Calculations and Tariff Policies of SJ" (jointly with E. Lindahl, 1941), published in economic academic journals.
